metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: Java Numbers
Numbers
Primitive number types are divided into two groups:
content.html: Primitive number types are divided into two groups:

content.text: Integer types stores whole numbers, positive or negative (such as 123 or -456), without decimals. Valid types are byte , short , int and long . Which type you should use, depends on the numeric value.
content.html: Integer types stores whole numbers, positive or negative (such as 123 or -456), without decimals. Valid types are byte, short, int and long. Which type you should use, depends on the numeric value.

content.text: Floating point types represents numbers with a fractional part, containing one or more decimals. There are two types: float and double .
content.html: Floating point types represents numbers with a fractional part, containing one or more decimals. There are two types: float and double.

content.text: Even though there are many numeric types in Java, the most used for numbers are int (for whole numbers) and double (for floating point numbers). However, we will describe them all as you continue to read.
content.html: Even though there are many numeric types in Java, the most used for numbers are int (for whole numbers) and double (for floating point numbers). However, we will describe them all as you continue to read.

content.text: Integer Types
Byte
The byte data type can store whole numbers from -128 to 127. This can be used instead of int or other integer types to save memory when you are certain that the value will be within -128 and 127:
content.html: The byte data type can store whole numbers from -128 to 127. This can be used instead of int or other integer types to save memory when you are certain that the value will be within -128 and 127:

content.code:
byte
myNum
=

100
;


System
.
out
.
println
(
myNum
)
;
content.code_html:
byte myNum = 100;
System.out.println(myNum);

content.text: Short
The short data type can store whole numbers from -32768 to 32767:
content.html: The short data type can store whole numbers from -32768 to 32767:

content.code:
short
myNum
=

5000
;


System
.
out
.
println
(
myNum
)
;
content.code_html:
short myNum = 5000;
System.out.println(myNum);

content.text: Int
The int data type can store whole numbers from -2147483648 to 2147483647. In general, and in our tutorial, the int data type is the preferred data type when we create variables with a numeric value.
content.html: The int data type can store whole numbers from -2147483648 to 2147483647. In general, and in our tutorial, the int data type is the preferred data type when we create variables with a numeric value.

content.code:
int
myNum
=

100000
;


System
.
out
.
println
(
myNum
)
;
content.code_html:
int myNum = 100000;
System.out.println(myNum);

content.text: Long

The long data type can store whole numbers from -9223372036854775808 to 9223372036854775807. This is used when int is not large enough to store the value. Note that you should end the value with an "L":
content.html: The long data type can store whole numbers from -9223372036854775808 to 9223372036854775807. This is used when int is not large enough to store the value. Note that you should end the value with an "L":

content.code:
long
myNum
=

15000000000L
;


System
.
out
.
println
(
myNum
)
;
content.code_html:
long myNum = 15000000000L;
System.out.println(myNum);

content.text: Floating Point Types
You should use a floating point type whenever you need a number with a decimal, such as 9.99 or 3.14515.
content.html: You should use a floating point type whenever you need a number with a decimal, such as 9.99 or 3.14515.

content.text: The float and double data types can store fractional numbers. Note that you should end the value with an "f" for floats and "d" for doubles:
content.html: The float and double data types can store fractional numbers. Note that you should end the value with an "f" for floats and "d" for doubles:

content.code:
float
myNum
=

5.75f
;


System
.
out
.
println
(
myNum
)
;
content.code_html:
float myNum = 5.75f;
System.out.println(myNum);

myNum
=

;


System
.

.

(

)
;
content.code_html:

System.out.println(myNum);

content.text: Use float or double ?

The precision of a floating point value indicates how many digits the value can have after the decimal point. The precision of float is only six or seven decimal digits, while double variables have a precision of about 16 digits. Therefore it is safer to use double for most calculations.
content.html: The precision of a floating point value indicates how many digits the value can have after the decimal point. The precision of float is only six or seven decimal digits, while double variables have a precision of about 16 digits. Therefore it is safer to use double for most calculations.

content.text: Scientific Numbers
A floating point number can also be a scientific number with an "e" to indicate the power of 10:
content.html: A floating point number can also be a scientific number with an "e" to indicate the power of 10:

content.code:
float
f1
=

35e3f
;


double
d1
=

12E4d
;


System
.
out
.
println
(
f1
)
;


System
.
out
.
println
(
d1
)
;
content.code_html:
float f1 = 35e3f;
double d1 = 12E4d;
System.out.println(f1);
System.out.println(d1);
